name: Dumps
headline: Where friends connect through photos and chaotic messaging
description: Dumps is where friends connect through photos and chaotic messaging.  Our users crave an expressive, low-stakes place to share their lives and interact.

founders.name: Seth Harris, Founder
founders.description: Seth graduated from Yale, worked at McKinsey and then left to do what everyone does:  open a nightclub in NYC.  He owned and operated several Manhattan bars and restaurants before founding Breadcrumb, a fully-featured hospitality point-of-sale acquired by Groupon.  Seth was VP POS & Payments Product at Groupon, where he grew the business to thousands of customers and tens of millions in revenue.

generated_description:
**Dumps: A Fresh Take on Social Connection**

Dumps was founded in 2020 as part of the Y Combinator Batch S20, a breeding ground for innovative startups. Located in New York and with a lean team of 9 dedicated employees, Dumps is all about creating a place where friends can connect through spontaneous photo sharing and unfiltered messaging. The mission? To provide users with an expressive, low-stakes environment for sharing everyday moments and experiences.

The essence of Dumps lies in its chaotic charm, catering to those who crave an alternative to the more curated social platforms. It embraces the beauty of real life in all its unpredictable glory. Users can expect a platform that feels familiar yet refreshing—a digital space where conversation flows freely and images speak volumes.

Dumps is tagged with key identifiers like "consumer," "messaging," "social," and "social-network," making it clear where it stands in the tech landscape. Led by Group Partner Gustaf Alstromer, Dumps offers a unique proposition in the social media world, emphasizing connections over competition. 

For more information, check out their website at [Dumps](https://dumps.app) and browse their [FAQ section](https://dumps.app/<https:/dumpsapp.notion.site/Dumps-FAQ-2e5812d324c7470ebf00398d974ca50e>) for additional insights. You can also catch them on social media platforms like [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dumps.app) and [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@dumps.app).

Dumps isn't just another social app; it's a vibrant community waiting to blossom. Keep an eye on this one—it's redefining how we connect.
